Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [BTC-BTC-BTC#4223] Does Magnum wallet supports all kmd tokens?

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] Not all KMD tokens yet but yes it has the capacity to do so. Chainzilla is Magnum's preferred onboarding partner. That means if a Komodo asset wants to be added to Magnum they should come to us and we will onboard them.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] We are preparing the pricing sheets with the Magnum team. They will be ready in a week or so.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content:
[LocoMB#8593] does chainzilla have a bitcointalk thread? 
troll infested and BTC maximalist censored as that place may be, it is still good for following a lot of trends

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] Bitcointalk has the lowest performance out of all the websites we promote. We are focusing on Facebook, medium, LinkedIn, Twitter, discord, Reddit, and telegram. We do update bct every now and then but it's not our demographic.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] Since we don't have unlimited resources, low performing things need to be replaced with high performing and low cost solutions.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] We're now using Google and Facebook ads which have a better reach at a lower cost and with more statistics

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] The medium page I think is the main source of written content

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] https://medium.com/chainzilla

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content:
[gh√∏st#7639] The main goal of the bounty (including on the BT–°T forum) is the distribution of a small part of the coins among the community.
Real investment goes to the project another way.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [Deri Septian Nugroho  UTC+8#7696] I agree with that, advertising on Facebook is indeed cheaper, but the reach on the bitcointalk is right on target that they are genuine krypto fans

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] @Unknown so what you are trying to say is that we should focus our efforts on BCT because it has "genuine crypto fans"?

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] Have you ever done any marketing campaigns on BCT for extended periods of time and analyzed the traffic data back to your project?

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] @gh√∏st true, and 2 years ago I would have said BCT was the place to be for true believers. However, now we spend more time filtering out the bots when we run bounties and any sort of distribution campaign. The same goes for most channels but BCT is full of people that make profits off signing up to as many bounties as possible and dumping as early as possible.  Discord has done a better job a trickling bounties than BCT.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] At the end of the day, we try to make decisions based on the numbers. BCT has been put to the side because it wasn't yielding results. Simple as that.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content:
[gh√∏st#7639] @PTYX 
"BCT has been put to the side because it wasn't yielding results..."

And what results did you expect from BT–°T?
 (signature campaign)?

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] We are looking for traffic. When we post across channels, we look at which posts brought more traffic to the website. We also tried the signature campaign. That brought minimal traffic. So no results overall. I'm sure there are projects who make bct work for them, mostly mining projects.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content:
[gh√∏st#7639] You had an extremely small payment per signature.
And the limit is the senior - minimum.

I can say my opinion, no more:
- Or quantity (from junior)
- Or quality (the best authors)

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [gh√∏st#7639] 7 people of whom only one wrote fine

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] Everyone has their opinion about the matter.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] I respect and appreciate your opinion but we have a clear path set. I'm not diverging resources to support forums that don't drive any traffic or generate any business.

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [gh√∏st#7639] $ 25 in a coin for a senior is statistically very small. (week)

Author: Komodo-Bot#0171
Content: [PTYX#6840] We used other bounties as a benchmark. The bitblend bounty to be specific.

Content:
[gh√∏st#7639] We just talk.
 decide - only you.
